comments:
There is a model source file in the Hyades source tree which causes a 
repeatable error when opening it in the Sample XML Schema Editor that I got 
with the M8 build of WSWB. 

The file in question is in the dev.eclipse.org CVS repository, 
path /home/tools, in org.eclipse.hyades.models.probekit/src/models/probekit.xsd 
and I have attached the contents of the file as it appears in my workspace, 
just in case it's content-sensitive. 

I am able to open the file in the Eclipse "plain text" editor.

Opening it with the Sample XML Schema Editor, I got an alert box in my 
Workbench saying "An error occurred while activating this view." Below is the 
error log report I got:

I downloaded the Hyades build from 20040407 and installed it in an M8 WSWB and 
now I get a slightly different error. Remember, my Eclipse Core is from the 
WSWB bundle dated 3/31, which I believe is M8 final. The ZIP file is called 
wswb-3.0M8-200403311308. I don't have a newer core handy.

Opening the indicated XSD file, first I get an alert: "Unable to create part: 
probekit.xsd"

When I say OK to that I get another alert: "An error has occurred when 
activating this view."

There are two entries in the error log. The newest one is the same as the 
exception stack traceback I reported earlier. The older one says this:

Created an attachment (id=9309)
The .log file with five related reports with stack traces

In my last comment I failed to include important information from three other
entries in my Error Log. They were not errors (just warnings) so I didn't think
they were important, but then I saw they came from org.eclipse.xsd.editor so
obviously they're pertinent.

I have attached my entire log, which includes the two stack traces already
given and also three from warnings that came from org.eclipse.xsd.editor.

I'm pretty sure this is happening because the registered namespace of your 
generated EPackage exactly matches the location of the .xsd and that the package 
ends up being "loaded" instead of the .xsd. That would explain the wierdness you 
are seeing (i.e., the class cast exception) and why I am not seeing that in my 
environment where Hyades is not installed.  I'll think about a way to fix it...
The cause was as I suspected.  The fix to XSDEditor.java is in CVS.
The fix is available in the I200404281648 build.
